subject: Using mock objects
msgSnippet: I m new to JUnit, and am wondering about using mock objects with JUnit. I wa looking at www.mockobjects.com, and on the right side of the page it lists
messageBody:
I'm new to JUnit, and am wondering about using mock objects with JUnit. I wa
looking at www.mockobjects.com, and on the right side of the page it lists
"implementations", and for Java it says jMock, EasyMock, and rMock.

What does it mean by implementations? What standard or specification are
they implementing, if any?

Or are they really very different things that only use the "concept" of mock
objects, but implement it very differently?

Any advice for a beginner as to which of those three implementations to look
at (any difference in functionality, robustness, or any other criteria?).
Looking at their websites I couldn't really tell what the main differences
are.

Thanks.
--
View this message in context: http://www.nabble.com/Using-mock-objects-tf2812332.html#a7848015
Sent from the JUnit - User mailing list archive at Nabble.com.
